channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024040664
item.description:
Report X-2024040664

item.title: Report X-2024040362
item.description:
Report X-2024040362

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Flora Fresh 2.5-gallon had defective lids resulted to leakage. The lids were defective due to being secure but still leaking liquid content. The plastic plug seal beneath lid was also defective. DescribePack: Bottle had defective lids resulted to leakage. The lids were defective due to being secure but still leaking liquid content. The plastic plug seal beneath lid was also defective. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box came off a van-line leaking during the sort. It was put into a red tote and HazMat bag before moving to the HazMat Cage. DescribePack: One cap of one jug came loose and leaked out. The box's bottom and side were soaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The HazMat was moved into the HazMat Cage inside a red tote and a Haz-bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX DISCOVERED DURING PRELOAD SORT. UPON INSPECTION, DISCOVERED THAT CAPS ON BOTTLES INSIDE BOX WERE BROKEN OR MISSING. BOX PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED INSIDE SALVAGE DRUM, AND PUT IN HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: MISSING AND BROKEN CAPS ON BOTTLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX PLACED IN BAG AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024040288
item.description:
Report X-2024040288

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The 20 liters metal pail arrived wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The metal pail is heavily dented on one side and it leaked from the bottom part. About 20 ounces were released. The shipper did not use a shipping box and/or outer packaging materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet metal pail, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2024040225
item.description:
Report X-2024040225

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered at 4:00 today by QA. Upon inspecting the package, QA found that the cap on the bottle inside of the box was not on the bottle, resulting in the contents being released. DescribePack: Cap not properly secured on bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA cleaned the contents off of the floor that was released, and placed the package inside of a hazmat bag, as well as a hazmat drum, to await further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040220
item.description:
Report X-2024040220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer in improper packing. Which resulted in packaged becoming damaged. Upon inspection, we seen the package was a hazmat. We then quickly secured package in a hazmat bag and bin. Package was then placed in designated hazmat cage. DescribePack: Contents had loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package came off trailer in improper packing. Which resulted in packaged becoming damaged. Upon inspection, we seen the package was a hazmat. We then quickly secured package in a hazmat bag and bin. Package was then placed in designated hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040219
item.description:
Report X-2024040219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer in improper packing. Which resulted in packaged becoming damaged. Upon inspection, we seen the package was a hazmat. We then quickly secured package in a hazmat bag and bin. Package was then placed in designated hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package had no inside protection (i.e. air filled bags, dividers, etc) One of the containers had a loose cap causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package came off trailer in improper packing. Which resulted in packaged becoming damaged. Upon inspection, we seen the package was a hazmat. We then quickly secured package in a hazmat bag and bin. Package was then placed in designated hazmat cage.
